meanings.definition: An instance of overflowing or spreading beyond its limits.
meanings.sent1: The spillover from the cup stained the tablecloth.
meanings.sent2: The spillover of water from the bathtub made a mess on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The spillover of popcorn during the movie made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The spillover of emotions in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The spillover of excitement at the party was contagious.

meanings.definition: The transfer of something from one place or situation to another.
meanings.sent1: The spillover of knowledge from the lecture helped me in the exam.
meanings.sent2: The spillover of funds from one account to another caused confusion.
meanings.sent3: The spillover of gossip from the office spread quickly.
meanings.sent4: The spillover of energy from the team captain motivated the players.
meanings.sent5: The spillover of perfume from her bag filled the room with a sweet scent.
